info.name: Common Object Management Service (COMS)
info.description:
A microservice for managing access control to S3 Objects

Contact Support:
 Name: NR Common Service Showcase
 Email: NR.CommonServiceShowcase@gov.bc.ca

item.name: Object

header.description: An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

formdata.description: This endpoint can accept an arbitrary number of form-data keys. There must be at least one key present, and every key must be unique. All keys shall contain a binary representation of the file to upload. In the response, each successfully uploaded file shall contain a 'fieldName' property corresponding to your custom defined keys.

query.description: Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

request.description: Create object(s) in the configured object storage. If COMS is running in either 'OIDC' or 'Full' mode, any objects created with OIDC user authentication will have all object permissions assigned to them by default.

response.name: Returns an array of created object data

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

formdata.description: This endpoint can accept an arbitrary number of form-data keys. There must be at least one key present, and every key must be unique. All keys shall contain a binary representation of the file to upload. In the response, each successfully uploaded file shall contain a 'fieldName' property corresponding to your custom defined keys.

header.description: An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

query.description: Uuid or array of uuids representing the object
The canonical S3 path string of the object
Boolean on active status
Boolean on public status
The object MIME Type
the `name` metadata for the object Typically a descriptive title or original filename

Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

request.description: Returns a list of objects matching all search criteria across all known versions of objects. If the request is BasicAuth authenticated, all search and filtered results will appear. However, If the request is BearerAuth authenticated, only objects that the user has at least one permission associated with, will appear in addition to their filtering parameters.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

query.description: Request a specified version

request.description: Returns S3 and COMS headers for a specific object

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
Specifies presentational information for the object
Size of the body in bytes
An entity tag (ETag) is an opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific version of a resource found at a URL
Creation date of the object

If the object is stored using server-side encryption either with an AWS KMS key or an Amazon S3-managed encryption key, the response includes this header with the value of the server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
Version of the object
The Object ID
The original filename of the object

query.description: Download mode behavior. Default behavior (undefined) will yield an HTTP 302 redirect to the S3 bucket via presigned URL. If `proxy` is specified, the object contents will be available proxied through COMS. If `url` is specified, expect an HTTP 201 cotaining the presigned URL as a JSON string in the response.
How many seconds the pre-signed URL should remain valid for
Request a specified version

request.description: Returns the object as either a direct binary stream, an HTTP 201 containing a direct, temporary pre-signed S3 object URL location, or an HTTP 302 redirect to a direct, temporary pre-signed S3 object URL location.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
Specifies presentational information for the object
Size of the body in bytes
An entity tag (ETag) is an opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific version of a resource found at a URL
Creation date of the object

If the object is stored using server-side encryption either with an AWS KMS key or an Amazon S3-managed encryption key, the response includes this header with the value of the server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
Version of the object
The Object ID
The original filename of the object
Added as a part of security scheme: basic

response.name: Returns a temporary pre-signed S3 object URL location header

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
URL Location of the moved resource
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

formdata.description: This endpoint will accept only one arbitrary form-data key. That key shall contain a binary representation of the file to upload. In the response, the successfully uploaded file shall contain a 'fieldName' property corresponding to your custom defined key.

query.description: Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

request.description: Updates the object in the configured object storage. If the object storage supports versioning, a new version will be generated instead of overwriting the existing contents.

response.name: Returns the updated object data

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

formdata.description: This endpoint will accept only one arbitrary form-data key. That key shall contain a binary representation of the file to upload. In the response, the successfully uploaded file shall contain a 'fieldName' property corresponding to your custom defined key.

item.name: Deletes an object or a version of object

query.description: delete a specified version. If not provided a delete-marker will be created (see S3 documentation)

request.description: Deletes the specified object (or version) from S3. If the object storage supports versioning, precise S3 version stack manipulation is supported, including soft-deletion and soft-restore. Hard-deletions on S3 are also supported. For more details on general S3 version behavior, visit https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/DeletingObjectVersions.html

response.name: Object or version was deleted from object storage and COMS database

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description: Returns an array of an object's version history

response.name: Returns an array of versions for a specific object

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

item.name: Sets the public flag of an object

query.description: Boolean on public status

request.description: Toggles the public property for an object. Sets public to false if public query parameter is not specified.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

item.description: Operations directly influencing an S3 Object. Certain operations not available without a database.

item.name: Object Metadata

header.description: An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

query.description: Add to metadata that exists on a specific version.

request.description: Creates a copy and new version of the object with the given metadata added to the object. Multiple Key/Value pairs can be provided in the header for the metadata.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

query.description: replace metadata from a specified version

request.description: Creates a copy and new version of the object with the given metadata replacing the existing. Multiple Key/Value pairs can be provided in the header for the metadata.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.

query.description: Request a specified version

request.description: Creates a copy and new version of the object with the given metadata removed. Multiple Key/Value pairs can be provided in the header for the metadata. If no metadata headers are given then all metadata will be removed. Metadata headers `name` and `id` are mandatory and will always persist.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic
An arbitrary metadata key/value pair. Must contain the x-amz-meta- prefix to be valid. Multiple metadata pairs can be defined. keys must be unique and will be converted to lowercase.
value is not required, but if provided must exist for this key

item.description: Operations directly influencing the Metadata of an S3 Object.

item.name: Object Tagging

query.description: Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.
add tags to a specified version. If not provided, will use latest

request.description: Adds a specified set of tags to the object. Multiple Key/Value pairs can be provided in the query.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

query.description: Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.
Replace tags for a specified version

request.description: Replace the existing tag-set of an object with the set of given tags. Multiple Key/Value pairs can be provided in the query.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

query.description: Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.

Tags for the object, defined as a Key/Value tag. The query must be formatted in deepObject style notation, where a tag-set made out of multiple tags would be encoded something similar to `tagset[x]=a&tagset[y]=b`. Only one value can exist for a given tag key.
Delete tags from a specified version

request.description: Removes the specified set of tags from the object. Multiple Key/Value pairs can be provided in the query. All tags in the tag-set will be removed from the object if no tags are specified.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

item.description: Operations directly influencing the Tags of an S3 Object.

item.name: Permission

query.description: Uuid or array of uuids representing the object
Uuid or array of uuids representing the user
the permission type

request.description: Returns an array of permissions meeting the filtering parameters provided

response.name: Returns an array of objectId/userId/permCode triplets that match the provided parameters

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

query.description: Uuid or array of uuids representing the user
the permission type

request.description: Returns an array of permissions for a specific object meeting the filtering parameters provided

response.name: Returns an array of objectId/userId/permCode triplets that match the provided parameters

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

request.description: Adds permissions for a specific object to users by specifying an arbitrary array of permCode and user tuples. This is an idempotent operation, so users that already have a requested permission will remain unaffected. Only permissions successfully added to COMS will appear in the response.

response.name: Returns an array of added permissions

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

query.description: Uuid or array of uuids representing the user
the permission type

request.description: Removes permissions for a specific object by optionally specifying a set of users and subset of permissions to revoke. This is an idempotent operation, so users that already lack the specified permission(s) will remain unaffected. Only permissions successfully removed from COMS will appear in the response. WARNING: Specifying no parameters will delete all permissions associated with an object; it is possible to lock yourself out of your own object!

response.name: Returns an array of deleted permissions

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

item.description: Operations for managing User Access Control to S3 Objects. Not available without a database.

item.name: User

query.description: Uuid or array of uuids representing the user
Uuid or array of uuids representing the user (identified by optional `KC_IDENTITYKEY` env variable)
Idp or array of idps representing the identity provider(s) (i.e. `idir`, `bceid-basic`, etc)
Search by specific username
Search by specific email
Search by specific first name
Search by specific full name
Search by specific last name
Boolean on active status
General OR search across username, email and fullName. Intended for use in freetext searches or autofilling fields.

request.description: Returns a list of users based on the provided filtering parameters. At least one query parameter should be present.

response.name: Returns a JSON object representation of the user matching provided parameters

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

query.description: Boolean on active status

request.description: Returns a list of all currently known identity providers

response.name: Returns a JSON array of known identity providers

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

item.description: Operations to list valid queryable users and identity providers. Not available without a database.
